oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Elementary Certificate for Ada M. Ateman
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: State of Tennessee Department of Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Schools
African American college students; African American universities and colleges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Official State of Tennessee certificate printed on cream paper in black ink, with typed entries for name, degree, college, quarter hours earned and date of graduation. Signed by [unreadable], Commissioner of Education and C.M. Hardison, Supervisor of Certification, and embossed the seal of Department of Education, dated 6th April 1945.
This "permanent professional elementary certificate" certifies that Ada M. Ateman was a graduate of LeMoyne College with a B.S. (30 quarter hours) in Education in June 1936.
